SEARCH
Package io.avery.conveyor

Class DeadlineSegue<In,Out>

java.lang.Object
io.avery.conveyor.DeadlineSegue<In,Out>
Type Parameters:
In - the sink's input element type
Out - the source's output element type
All Implemented Interfaces:
Belt.Segue<In,Out>, Belt.SinkStepSource<In,Out>, Belt.StepSegue<In,Out>, Belt.StepSinkSource<In,Out>
public abstract class DeadlineSegue<In,Out> extends Object implements Belt.StepSegue<In,Out>
A StepSegue that uses deadlines to manage timed waits for pushes and pulls, and provides several lifecycle hooks to simplify state management. Each lifecycle hook executes under synchronization, ensuring exclusive access to state. Lifecycle hooks receive controller objects with methods to "latch" deadlines or outputs. Latched deadlines and outputs are applied after the hook returns, or discarded if the hook throws an exception.

  • Constructor Details

    • DeadlineSegue

  • Method Details

    • clock

      protected Clock clock()
      Returns the clock that this segue uses for timed waits. Deadlines are compared to the clock's current Instant to calculate how long to wait.

      The default clock is Clock.systemUTC(), which provides the current instant as if by calling Instant.now().

      Returns:
      the clock that this segue uses for timed waits.

    • onInit

      protected abstract void onInit(DeadlineSegue.SinkController ctl) throws Exception
      Runs synchronized when the first pull, push, or complete reaches this segue's source or sink, before awaiting any deadlines. The given controller can be used to latch initial push or pull deadlines. Otherwise, the initial push deadline is Instant.MIN, and the initial pull deadline is Instant.MAX. This method can also be used to late-initialize state for this segue.

      Latched values are discarded if this method throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      ctl - the controller
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to initialize

    • onPush

      protected abstract void onPush(DeadlineSegue.SinkController ctl, In input) throws Exception
      Runs synchronized each time an input element is pushed to this segue's sink, after awaiting the current push deadline. The given controller can be used to latch subsequent push or pull deadlines. The input element can be accumulated onto this segue's state, in preparation for later pushes or pulls.

      Latched values are discarded if this method throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      ctl - the controller
      input - the pushed input element
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to push

    • onPull

      protected abstract void onPull(DeadlineSegue.SourceController<Out> ctl) throws Exception
      Runs synchronized each time an output element is pulled from this segue's source, after awaiting the current pull deadline. The given controller can be used to latch subsequent push or pull deadlines, as well as to latch an output element or close signal. If no output or close is latched, the pull will restart after applying any latched deadlines.

      Latched values are discarded if this method throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      ctl - the controller
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to pull

    • onComplete

      protected abstract void onComplete(DeadlineSegue.SinkController ctl) throws Exception
      Runs synchronized when this segue's source is completed (normally). The given controller can be used to latch a subsequent pull deadline. The push deadline will be ignored, since the sink will no longer accept pushes after this method returns normally.

      Latched values are discarded if this method throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      ctl - the controller
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to complete

    • sink

      public Belt.StepSink<In> sink()
      Returns the sink side of this segue.

      The sink can be safely pushed to and completed concurrently.

      Specified by:
      sink in interface Belt.Segue<In,Out>
      Specified by:
      sink in interface Belt.StepSinkSource<In,Out>
      Returns:
      the sink side of this segue

    • source

      public Belt.StepSource<Out> source()
      Returns the source side of this segue.

      The source can be safely pulled and closed concurrently.

      Specified by:
      source in interface Belt.Segue<In,Out>
      Specified by:
      source in interface Belt.SinkStepSource<In,Out>
      Returns:
      the source side of this segue
